message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CYBER. 

The paper proposes an adaptive model for news recommendation that combines similarities in users' rating patterns with epidemic-like spreading of news on an evolving network. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Social and Information Retrieval (cs.SI, cs.IR) as it deals with user behavior and information retrieval. The paper also discusses the robustness of the model against bias and malicious behavior, which could fall under the sub-category of Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER). Additionally, the paper proposes a general social mechanism for recommender systems, which could be related to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SOC). Finally, the paper uses computer agent-based simulations to measure the performance of the model, which could be related to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG).
